alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 5:47PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Slow-moving showers and thunderstorms produced heavy rain between Meeteetse and Meeteetse Rim Sunday afternoon. The heaviest rain fell in the Cottonwood Creek, Long Hollow, and Meeteetse Creek drainages. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry washes and draws caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small creeks and streams, along with flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain caused by showers and thunderstorms. This will produce small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry washes and draws. Between 1.00 and 1.50 inches was estimated to have fallen between 3 PM and 5 PM Sunday. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.25 inches are possible after 7 PM, with only light rainfall until that time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cottonwood Creek, Long Hollow, Meeteetse Creek, Meeteetse Rim, Meeteetse Creek Road, Valley Road, and the Lower Greybull River Road near the intersection with Wyoming Highway 120.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown! Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
